Sounds more like you haven't set the HERITRIX_HOME env variable before starting up.

best
-- 
Bjarne Andersen

Kaleb wrote:
> If you are running from a bin distribution on *nix, I believe you need
> to set JAVA_HOME in your ENV vars "export
> JAVA_HOME=/path/to/your/java".  This probably pertains to Win32 also.
> 
> But from my experience (I'm just another new user), once you start
> heritrix, it binds to port 8080 (or whatever you told it to bind to)
> and then the webroot on that port is the heritrix log in screen.  
> 
> That error makes me think that the problem is Heritrix can't find a
> JRE lib because your CLASSPATH isn't set correctly.  So you probably
> diagnosed the problem yourself :)   
> 
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "smile_a_while_with_adii"
> <smile_a_while_with_adii@...> wrote:
> 
>>I am particularly a new heritrix user.
>>I have cofigured hadoop.
>>But main problem i am facing is i am not Getting URI(USER INTERFACE)
>>that is generated on the initial run.
>>getting this error in heritrix_out.log
>>
>>"Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
>>org.archive.crawler.Heritrix
>>   at gnu.java.lang.MainThread.run (libgcj.so.7)
>>Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
>>javax.management.DynamicMBean not found in
>>gnu.gcj.runtime.SystemClassLoader"
>>
>>Is there a file in Heritrix where Java_home needs to be set.
>>
>>can any one just tell me a detail information to generate this URI for
>>Web Interface of heritrix. please reply i am in need.
>>
> 
> 
> 
> 




--Boundary_(ID_eQf7IqrUlmJ62OurWM3ppQ)
